replies.commentBody: It is not treasonous because at this point it is nothing more than wishful thinking on the part of Dems. If Obama had dirt on Trump, you bet he would have played his hand.
Yes.  But this House GOP and this Senate GOP will never appoint an independent prosecutor; they will convene their own judiciary and ethics committees and tell us there's no need.

comments.commentBody: This makes Watergate look like a domestic matter. It seems entirely plausible and worth investigating if Trump or his team coordinated Russian influence in the election. How is that not treasonous?

replies.commentBody: Not always ... Jane Fonda, for example, thrived after her visit to Hanoi in which she symbolically participated in the shooting down of American planes.

comments.commentBody: I think we hang traitors.

replies.commentBody: USA Today admittedly a melba toast newspaper had an excellent expose of facts about Russian investment in Trump properties around Sunday Dec. 21st, and not one other news media outlet has noted it, or expanded on it.

comments.commentBody: This still blows my mind.  The fact that Republicans want to sweep it under the rug is completely unconscionable.  Why does it seem like journalists know more and are connecting dots a lot faster than our intelligence agencies.  How difficult can it be to investigate to investigate this mess?

A lot of words to say business people met with government officials from a state where the government controls information and the economy. There is just enough here to get everyone's hopes up, but no evidence of wrong doing by a current member of the administration. I have the sense that if a foreign or domestic intelligence service new something, then we would know by now. Its not like people are standing in line to shield the POTUS from embarrassment. This story most likely turns out to be the left's version of Benghazi, a smoking pile of wet leaves that never ignites.
The GOP will quash it anyhow.

There is a cancer in the Trump Administration. This cancer eats at all Administration credibility. To cure this cancer, there has to be a complete and thorough (extreme) vetting of the association between the Trump business, the Trump campaign, and the Russian intelligence agency.

This investigation has to be done by an independent prosecutor who is able to go where necessary, ask what is necessary, subpoena all persons necessary, and who has the mandate to find the root of the issue and expose it to the light of day.

Until this investigation is completed, until Mr. Trump releases his taxes, and until there is no doubt that the Trump campaign and Mr. Trump have not be engaged with the Russians, Donald J. Trump is not my President.

replies.commentBody: "Why shouldn't they be allowed to elect our leadership"?  You're joking, right?  How about allowing American citizens to vote in Russian elections?

comments.commentBody:
I am sympathetic to this excellent reporting and polemic, but it seems that the whole perspective here is Cold War Liberalism, which is not to say the Russians are nice guys.

When global corporations legally and routinely intervene in our systemically flawed elections, why should some dabbling by Russia concern us? What is the point of this article? We are to be shocked, shocked to discover influence in the election process?

And why, in the view of Liberalism, shouldn't the entire planet be allowed to vote in American elections? Our State drastically affects the lives of people in Russia, Iran, China, Mexico, etc. What shouldn't they be allowed to elect our leadership?

American Liberalism is tragically confused! TheLeft must get its act together! Focus, focus!

The truth will come out and when it does it will NOT be good news for Trump. No doubt the Republicans in congress will 'slow walk' the investigations, which is why Trump continually attacks media outlets like the New York Times.

An independent commission must be convened to investigate Russia's ties to Trump's Presidential win. This commission must be bipartisan, consisting of no one currently holding office, and accountable only to the truth. Much like the 9/11 commission. If an investigation into Russia's meddling in the election is done in the Republican House nothing will be found. It will be Party over Country. Trump will walk free. Russia will have triumphed over our American democracy. We must demand an independent commission only.

The biggest part of the story that does not add up is why would Flynn be acting alone? It does not make sense for Flynn to just initiate contact with Kislyak about US-Russia relations and sanctions without getting any guidance from the Trump and Pence team. The narrative that was created when he resigned was that he contradicted himself and did not tell the truth to Pence. I guess Flynn was the good soldier, falling on the sword his president gave him. Between Manafort and Flynn, and all of Trump's odd Putin praise during the summer, there has to be a lot more to this story and I hope a non-partisan investigation gets to the bottom of it.

replies.commentBody: It is not surprising to see a comment as this. It is really the same position taken duting campaign.  But this is not about Hillary,  it is about people thst quite possibly committed TREASON. I understand dotting the I"s and crossing the T's, just hope it doesn't have drag out much longer. But take the time to make it stick and scoop up as many involved as possible.

comments.commentBody: Interesting... the story left out that the leaks were coming from David Laufman of the DOJ. He is the source for the National Security Breach and will likely face a rough road ahead. There is no Russian - Trump story, the highest members of the intelligence community have already verified this. Hillary perjured herself to the nation and lost the election. I'm quite certain her or the former administration has any interest in a select committee digging too far into the "leaks" and corruption surrounding the election.

Produce photographs of the so-called president and Putin in flagrante delicto and his supporters will accuse you of virulent homophobia. Remember, Trump could shoot someone dead in the middle of Fifth Avenue, etc.

Thanks anyway, Obama Administration officials, but the GOP is fine with treason as long as the traitor is a Republican; see Iran-Contra and proof of Saddam's WMDs among other previous examples.

So the takeaway is that now that the Russians see how easy it is to instigate regime change in democracies via propaganda 101 and fancy-bear hack jobs and switch them over to being Soviet-style satellites (which appears to be the Faustian bargain made by the blackmailed and indebted power-mad Trump to gain the Presidency and turn the country over to his owner Putin) the rest of NATO will fall in a domino-theory pattern worthy of the Rockettes and Putin's consolidation of the lost Soviet regime reborn in him will be achieved. It's such a tacky way, but perhaps an inevitable one, for the free world to end, in vicious vulgarity, full of whimpering mediocrities, signifying naught but sadism, violence, and torture by whites against POC until, mercifully, Mother Earth pulls the plug on climate change. Until then, let's call this Trupumpensteinian creation the Federation of Misbegotten American Carnage States of the 1st Order of Scots/Germanic/Stalinist Miscegenated Monster Dudes.
I hope a lot of hard won knowledge in general was hidden from the crude blunt hands of the current (and, one hopes, short lived) administration. This was a smart move.

Let's not get ahead of the available information. This story seems prima facie correct and it's difficult if not impossible, without having access to the classified materials and knowing who was involved, to say anything more or to draw any additional conclusions regarding intent. This issue is ongoing, as it must be, and needs to be brought to conclusion as soon as responsibly possible. Premature and unsubstantiated assertions are mere speculation. The single observation that can be legitimately offered now is that Mr. Hall's statement "Once an intel guy, always an intel guy in Russia" applies universally, including to former American intelligence officials.
If true, & it turns out to be driven by more than paranoia/caution, it means this country may be at its greatest moment of existential crisis since 1863.

replies.commentBody: All the news, without fear or favor they say...

comments.commentBody:
Why does the Times frame an article like this to play into the
Trump/Republican propaganda machine? It will now say Obama tried to discredit Trump--even though the article denies that claim if the article is actually read. As was the case with Mr. Schmidt's many articles on Clinton's emails, the Times newsroom approach to setting up the stories seemed to invite exaggerated misappropriation. Can we believe that the Times is merely politically tone deaf?

I'd like to believe that the reason Republicans leaders are dragging their feet on investigating Trump et al. is that they have been sufficiently briefed by FBI and intelligence agencies who are investigating, that there very much is a problem. That problem may be treason. Acting in good faith toward the American people and the country, they want to know that if they start impeachment on the grounds of treason, they had damn well better have an air-tight case.

I'd like to believe that, but I'm not believing it yet. I will not know whether I am right unless the FBI etc. tells Congress that the evidence is air-tight, that they have at least one smoking gun, and Congress moves for impeachment.

Unfortunately, it is either my good judgment or my cynicism that tells me that the Republicans would rather cover it up even if they are told there is a smoking gun. This is not because they like Trump so much, which they certainly do not. It is because it will make them all look terribly foolish for having nominated him and supported him that they risk losing what appears to them to be likely control of the Presidency and both houses of Congress for eight years. That kind of power comes around very infrequently. Do McConnell and Ryan have enough character and integrity to do the right thing and risk that loss? They might, but they certainly have not shown it yet, and leopards do not change spots.

replies.commentBody: Pence isn't any better at all ideologically.  Careful what we wish for.
Henry-- yes and no on getting caught up in the Trump drama --yes, it's costing me emotionally, and NO, he won't be gone unless we stand up and hold him accountable.

comments.commentBody:
Do not get all caught up in the Trump drama. He will be gone eventually.
Maybe sooner than you think.

This has to be the single most important issue concerning the Trump administration and it's an issue that Trump and associates have been working overtime in creating diversions from. It's important that this issue be pursued and thoroughly investigated.

We hear, from Trump's own family's public statements before he started running for President, that Russian investors make up a big source of funds for Trump. He says "he has no deals in Russia", which is a way of skirting the question of whether he receives investments from American companies whose ultimate beneficiaries are Russian investors. And there are no big Russian investors who don't cooperate closely with the Russian government. Their entire economic system is based on access and payola. So all indications are that Trump is in something up to his elbows.

replies.commentBody: Thank you, President Obama.  Country first!
Thanks for the reminder but we may not have two years- or even two months.
Yes, but that was back in the days of typewriters, telephones, and snail-mail.

comments.commentBody: Just a reminder, it took two years for Watergate to unravel.

Some of the people employed within our federal government's intelligence/security/surveillance apparatus need to (1) leak actual transcripts of phone calls or emails between Trump's staff and advisers and Russian officials or intelligence operatives, and/or (2) furnish the electronic data trail of Russian hacking into the DNC server or the emails of prominent Demi like John Podesta.  Anonymous claims to NYT reporters about the supposed existence of evidence will not do the trick (especially for those who are not already Dembots).  In doing so, these officials would be demonstrating the courage and patriotism shown by Chelsea Manning and Edward Snowden.  They might face incarceration for several years under the grueling conditions endured by Manning, but they would ultimately be hailed as heroes by our nation.

This is a serious matter taken non-seriously by the current administration.

Question is why will Trump administration before election was compelled and dying to be on the good side of the Russians? Why was it ignored Mr. Putin overall still is a foe to the US interests?

Why GOP leaders some of them whom were veterans of the armed forces still not acting in the interest of America instead of republican party?
I hope there are still people in the government to ensure checks and balances and accountability for the sake of national security.

replies.commentBody: Do you seriously think that a majority in the Republican controlled house will vote a bill of impeachment?  Not a chance, until the Democrats control the House again.   Do not hold your breath until that happens or you might turn blue and faint.

comments.commentBody: Debt of gratitude for the Obama administration for hopefully laying the groundwork for Impeachment--And  The Relentlessly Courageous New York Times for their commitment to the truth, duty to inform and the preserving the 1st Amendment.
